oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Joe L. Weakley Sr. in uniform, American Zouave soldier

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Military uniforms
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Light infantry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three-quarter length portrait of Joe Weakley Sr., believed to be a "Dunlap Zouave." He wears a traditional Zouave uniform with kepi and has an infantry sword on his belt.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bob Ray
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The "Dunlap Zouaves" were first called to enlist in Nashville in 1861. Zouaves adopted the dress of North African French light infantry, some regiments selecting it as their standard uniform, others being awarded "Zouave" uniforms for particularly impressive service records.
